The Gun play is really good, fun and intense with new features but still has small old school Bioshock at the same time. And the Story is like none I've ever experience. It's personally one of my favorite games now.
Doporučuji :) Zábavné, bohužel krátké s velkým zvratem na konci jaký jsem ve hře dlouho nezažil ;)

I came into this game thinking it was going to be a mere shadow of the first two games. My how i was very wrong. If you are a fan of the first two games in terms of game play you will find Infinite to have mastered the craft of the first two. In terms of story i still believe there is no beating the first game but i must say i do enjoy infinite's story a lot. The game is a masterful telling of an alternate world from the one of rapture where the flying city of Columbia is the center. Really i have nothing bad to say about this game and if your wondering if Infinite's story connects with the Rapture we know from the second game just play the two DLC Burial at Sea and you will see. Great game masterful work. Game play is a big improvement from the prior two games. You have gear pieces you can equip in order to gain certain effects to melee, personal body or weapons. Plenty of guns to choose from and the plasmids are a mix of old and new. If you enjoyed the first and second game, Bioshock infinite is a must as well.

把游戏做的像本小说一样，剧本的高乌托邦精神与现实交杂着，主人公一直反抗命运，却终究被命运玩弄。

挺好，但也没吹那么好吧，游戏的剧情是相当好，绝对算得上“第九艺术”，尤其是惊艳的开头和令人回味的结尾，尽管游戏流程不长，一般7-10个小时可以全通关，（前提是你知道寻路键(*￣︶￣)），但是说实话，这中间的剧情、战斗比较臃肿重复。
不过！！！！！！！不到五十块，就可以享受数小时的艺术体验，这真的很香，很值得买，毕竟，谁不喜欢伊丽莎白呢？(*￣︶￣)

What a hell of a ride! 1 hour in, and it is already better than the two previous Bioshock games. Not saying the previous Bioshock games are bad (they are pretty good too), but this is way to good. Right now this is my second favourite FPS shooter, right behind Half Life 2. Now I am going to talk about different gameplay elements. 

[h1]Story:[/h1]
Story was amazing! Without spoiling anything, the story leaves an after taste and also allows you to wanting to think about the story even after you finished. 

[h1]Characters:[/h1]
Characters are very fleshed out in this game, especially Elizabeth. The game shows a big different between Booker and Elizabeth, and how they see things. Elizabeth is also such a likeable character. 

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]
Now the gameplay is what makes this game awesome. So instead of plasmids, you get access to something called vigours, which essentially act like plasmids (they are the same thing). But basically, you can use these vigours in battle, and it really adds to gameplay. In addition, I really love how they managed guns in this game. In previous Bioshock games (or in a lot of other FPS games) ,you have a selected amount of weapons, and you get access to all of those different weapons all the time. However in Bioshock Infinite, you only get 2 weapons everytime. Therefore, you need to adapt to these kind of gameplay. So for example, there are around 10 different types of guns in the game, and whenever one of your guns run out, you will need to select a different weapon either from crates, or from NPC drops. I really love this type of gameplay because it allows quicker gameplay. Moreover, Elizabeth is a great addition in combat, she often finds random things and toss it to you (which is also why I love her). So if you are running low on health, she will toss you a health pack, if you are running low on ammo, she will toss you some ammo and so on. Elizabeth also helps in battle by summoning (not really summoning, but I will use this word for now) turrets, health packs or covers to help you in battle. Personally, I am not a fan of this, but it is a welcoming addition. Besides guns and vigous, Booker also has access to a melee weapon called the SkyHook, and it is brutal. You can use the Skyhook to violently murder your enemies, as well as flying around on a skyline. Skylies are my favourite thing in the game. They allow Booker to climb on one, and esentially acts like a roller coaster and fly you around. On a skyline, you can fly around to shoot enemies, or you can land on enemies to do something called a skyline execution. A skyline execution is also violent, and often deals a ton of damage. Overall, gameplay is incredibly solid, and I will give it a 9/10. 

[h1]Performance:[/h1]
Bioshock Infinite is very well optimised. I tried playing this on my crappy macbook pro 2017, and surprisingly I am getting 40 fps at maximum settings possible, and Bioshock Infinite has pretty good graphics. 

Overall, this game is incredibly solid, and I will give it an overall score of 9/10

Possibly the best Bioshock game out there. The shooting feels good and the story of the base game is amazing. However, although Burial At Sea was a nice return to Rapture, it completely messed up the story. And CITC felt like a lazy way to push a few more hours into it.

A Dark Stain on BioShock Franchise. This game is as generic as it gets. Did not get anywhere near the over-promised E3 demo shown before release. There is thousands of hours of documents as to why Ken screwed this game up from what was shown.

Gun Play is generic. The entire game is a rinse and repeat formula. Enter Arena kill 4-6 baddies. Next generic area and repeat add some half-baked humor and story and some audio logs and BioShock sound effects and that's Infinite for you. Outdated graphics even on Ultra. BioShock 1 and 2 Looks much better.

初入哥伦比亚，我想象我是哥谭的黑暗骑士，以一人之力拯救这座金玉其表的空中城市。伸出左手，我想象我的魔法会像子弹风暴中的电浆鞭，于电光火石间虐杀敌人。当我见到女孩，我想象我会像带着碍事梨逃出生天的李三光，体验一把哥伦比亚人民的热情好客。当我掏出吊钩，我想象我是16世纪游弋于中东各个屋顶的老年艾吉奥，华丽的击杀一个又一个敌人。但当我弹尽粮绝，一次次接住女孩不知从哪里捡来的弹药。当我来到海岸，看到日光下女孩的舞蹈。当我进入一个又一个时间漩涡，听着女孩声嘶力竭的求救。我心中唯一所想象的，只有夜晚的巴黎，灯火通明的街道，高大雄伟的铁塔，和奔跑在我身边的那个永远面露笑容的，蹦蹦跳跳的，叫做伊丽莎白的女孩。

Alright - so upon finishing the main game I can say I enjoyed this quite a bit. That said, I have to agree with some (minor?) complaints other reviews have made, and also point out a few of my own. 

1) The Sky-Line system is pretty cool, but underutilized. They sell it as a means of transport around the city, but in reality it's singularly used in maybe 4 or 5 areas in a VERY localized and looped way, basically just allowing you to move around that specific arena to different high grounds and get the jump-attack on enemies and such; it is NOT used as actual transportation.

2) The tear system is equally cool, but equally underutilized - it basically only shows up during large arena-style deathmatch fights with waves of mobs, and for the most part they don't really do anything particularly interesting with the system. You could pretty much ignore it completely in 99.9% of situations and it wouldn't change a thing.

3) The two-gun limit is stupid and obnoxious. There are MANY different weapons in this game, most weapon types have two different variants, and both variants use their own unique ammo. It's annoying to have to drop a weapon you're carrying to pick one up and it made me never want to spend any money upgrading any of them. You never know if you're going to be coming across ammo for weapons you actually have or weapons you don't have, and if you swap weapons to the type of ammo that's dropping then suddenly ammo for the weapon you just ditched 3 minutes is all you'll find.

4) The lack of ability to store (and later use) health packs and salt hypos like the last two BioShock games is baffling. Sometimes you've left running around looting trash cans for old food to restore tiny bits of your HP until you're full for 4 solid minutes because you couldn't pick up those you came across before when "full."

5) As others have mentioned, SEVERAL of the enemy-types in this game are such ridiculous bullet-sponges that you'll end up using up most if not all of your ammo for both weapons just trying to make it through that group of enemies, and then you're back to 5 minutes of hunting for scraps and looting bodies hoping they happen to be dropping one of the 18 ammo types the TWO guns you're carrying actually use - which most of the time, they're not.

6) The lack of any proper map is ridiculous. Period.

Still a good game, but flawed.

写了一下午评论了，好累啊，不过写评论的过程中又能想起当时玩游戏时是一种怎样的心境，倒也挺开心，包括看以前自己写过的评论，现在我想给自己定个规则，以后每打完一款游戏，都要写下评论以作为纪念，这是一个好习惯，日后对自己来说也是一笔精神财富。
写到生化奇兵无限这款游戏，记得当时买这个游戏的契机是因为看了豆瓣的一个游戏评测，对这个游戏的评价是完美诠释了何为第九艺术，当然，每个人自己对游戏的理解都不一样，我打完这款游戏也没有感受到别人口中的第九艺术是何物，就我来说的话，或者说我对一个游戏的评价最看重的方面就是 剧情，画面，音乐，玩法，就这几点来说，生化奇兵无限这款游戏还没有达到我的预期，它或许是别人眼中的第九艺术，但还达不到我心目中的神作水准。

bioshock serisi toplam 3 oyunu olan ve her oyunu iyi puanlara layık görülen güzel bir üçleme bioshock infinite oyunun üçlemesindeki son oyun yeni bir üçleme veya devam oyunu olarak çıkarmı tartışılır oyun 1912 tarihinde eski bir dedektif olan booker dewitt in kayıp şehir uçan kolombiyadan elizabeth isimli bir kızı getirmekle görevli bu görevi başarırsa görevi veren gizemli eleman booker dewitt in tüm kumar borçlarını silicektir bu fırsatı kaçırmayan booker dewiit uçan şehir kolobiya gitmek için yola çıkmıştır saat kulesine varan booker saat kulesindeki gizli bir asansörle yukarı çıkmış ver kayıp şehir kolombiya ya ulaşmıştır fakat fark etiği şey  kolombiya halkının farklı toplumlardan izole edilmiş ve sadece beyazların üstünlüğüne inana bir toplum olmuş buu yapan yönetici zachary hale comstock un yönettiği kolombiyada siyahi vb ırklar köle olarak çalıştırılmaktadır bunu dışında abraham lincon bu ülkede vatan haini olarak anılıyor ana hikaye bu daha fazla spoyler vermeden artılar ve eksikler

2021 Edit: DeWitt is a good name.

Главные достоинства этой игры -  очень запутанный и хорошо проработанный сюжет (хоть и он линейный и представляет собой лишь одну концовку, но зато какую;), а также связь с предыдущими играми Bioshock (по крайней мере с первой частью) посредством двух дополнений Bural at Sea. Все игры серии Bioshock представляют собой осмысление: как погоня за утопией, высокими идеалами и личные амбиции приводят к полному краху построенных империй. Если в первых двух играх представлена идеология объективизма Айн Рэнд, то в Bioshock Infinite не представлена одной какой-то идеологией, а отражает мир конца XIX - начала XX в., что только её углубляет. О достоинствах этой игры можно писать много, хотя есть и недостатки, но о них я не хочу писать. В общем, я люблю серию Bioshock (хотя и познакомился с ней только 2-3 года назад, а BI прошёл буквально на днях), но эта игра мне понравилась всё же больше предыдущих благодаря её атмосферности, сюжету, лору и плавной подачей истории. Рекомендую эту игру всем тем, кто не знаком с серией Bioshock или же прошёл первые две части (особенно, кому они понравились), но почему-то не сыграл в BI. На мой взгляд эта игра - лучшая в серии.

Very Well-designed arenas. If you want some good action FPS experience, I'll say you can buy this game without any hesitation.
 
Weapons and vigors (aka. plasmids in bioshock 1 & 2) are somehow not balanced, you'll soon realize that you only depend on some effective combinations in combats; but still, overall very sturdy design in character's weaponry. 

Plot is alright, I'll say 8 out of 10; some cliches here and there, and the narrative is a little messy, but overall good enough. (Sadly, personally I don't think it's "as good" as that of bioshock 1 & 2)

Overall, it's a great game you shouldn't miss, despite some petty flaws which are mentioned above.

However, if you are a well-experienced FPS gamer, you might find that the difficulty of this game is rather low; in that case, I suggest you play at hard difficulty at least (as I played the first time at hard and find it too easy, and played the second time in 1999 mode finding out that's the right difficulty for me.)

Who could anticipate that the series will explode like this? The second part was already better than the first one, but "Bioshock: Infinite" has overcome all possible expectations. 

The storytelling was amazing: no long cutscenes or boring reading - just a fluid flow of the events. The environment was gorgeous and filled with so much stuff that it actually began to confuse you. The multilevel concept lures you into a false sense of open-world game, which is a smart move. 

The choice of developers to move from multiple weapons to multiple Vigors (i.e. Plasmids) was genius as it diversified fights significantly. Although, I still mostly used 3, tops. But the variety of objects you can interact with makes it up for the lack of guns in your backpack. Believe me, you will forget about this aspect once you see what you are able to work with.

The soundtrack is outstanding, especially with some CCR popping out of nowhere. Summing up, this is the best game of the series so far.
